column4: the way I have done it in the past is make a bash script to run the application, then make a .desktop file in /usr/share/applications to run the script
if you copy a .desktop file from ~/.config/autostart  and modify it, you can make it run what you want.
I'm getting "Access denied" when I try to copy into /usr/share/applications
run:  gksudo nautilus $HOME    and you should be able to
